meaningMnemonic:
If you have <kanji>one</kanji> <kanji>thousand</kanji>, you have... <vocabulary>one thousand</vocabulary>.

Simply saying 千 is the most common way to say 1,000, but sometimes you might use 一千 to emphasize or clarify the exact number.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The only thing that's a bit weird is the reading of the 一. The ち turns into a small っ, making the reading for this word <reading>いっせん</reading>.
